lustre/tests/checkstat.c

00032 /*
00033  * Test program to compare the attributes of a files to verify that it
00034  * desired file attributes are present.  This file predates availability
00035  * of the stat(3) utility and is deprecated.  Either test(3) ([ ]) or
00036  * stat(3) should be used in all new tests.
00037  *
00038  * This file is part of Lustre, http://www.lustre.org/
00039  * Lustre is a trademark of Sun Microsystems, Inc.
00040  */
00041 
00042 #include <stdio.h>
00043 #include <stdlib.h>
00044 #include <sys/types.h>
00045 #include <sys/stat.h>
00046 #include <unistd.h>
00047 #include <errno.h>
00048 #include <string.h>
00049 #include <pwd.h>
00050 #include <grp.h>
00051 
00052 void
00053 usage (char *argv0, int help)
00054 {
00055         char *progname = strrchr(argv0, '/');
00056 
00057         if (progname == NULL)
00058                 progname = argv0;
00059 
00060         fprintf (help ? stdout : stderr,
00061                  "Usage: %s [flags] file[s]\n",
00062                  progname);
00063 
00064         if (!help)
00065         {
00066                 fprintf (stderr, "   or try '-h' for help\n");
00067                 exit (1);
00068         }
00069 
00070         printf ("Check given files have...\n");
00071         printf (" -p    permission       file must have required permissions\n");
00072         printf (" -t    dir|file|link    file must be of the specified type\n");
00073         printf (" -l    link_name        file must be a link to the given name\n");
00074         printf (" -s    size             file must have the given size\n");
00075         printf (" -u    user             file must be owned by given user\n");
00076         printf (" -g    group            file must be owned by given group\n");
00077         printf (" -f                     follow symlinks\n");
00078         printf (" -a                     file must be absent\n");
00079         printf (" -v                     increase verbosity\n");
00080         printf (" -h                     print help\n");
00081         printf (" Exit status is 0 on success, 1 on failure\n");
00082 }
00083 
00084 int
00085 main (int argc, char **argv)
00086 {
00087         int           c;
00088         struct stat64 buf;
00089         int           perms = -1;
00090         uid_t         uid = (uid_t)-1;
00091         gid_t         gid = (gid_t)-1;
00092         char         *type = NULL;
00093         long          absent = 0;
00094         char         *checklink = NULL;
00095         int           verbose = 0;
00096         long long     size = -1;
00097         int           follow = 0;
00098         char         *term;
00099 
00100         while ((c = getopt (argc, argv, "p:t:l:s:u:g:avfh")) != -1)
00101                 switch (c)
00102                 {
00103                 case 'p':
00104                         perms = (int)strtol (optarg, &term, 0);
00105                         if (term == optarg)
00106                         {
00107                                 fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse permission %s\n", optarg);
00108                                 return (1);
00109                         }
00110                         break;
00111 
00112                 case 'l':
00113                         checklink = optarg;
00114                         break;
00115 
00116                 case 's':
00117                         size = strtoll (optarg, &term, 0);
00118                         if (term == optarg)
00119                         {
00120                                 fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse size %s\n", optarg);
00121                                 return (1);
00122                         }
00123                         break;
00124 
00125                 case 'u':
00126                         if (*optarg == '#')
00127                         {
00128                                 uid = (uid_t)strtol (optarg + 1, &term, 0);
00129                                 if (term == optarg + 1)
00130                                 {
00131                                         fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse numeric uid %s\n", optarg);
00132                                         return (1);
00133                                 }
00134                         } else {
00135                                 struct passwd *pw = getpwnam (optarg);
00136 
00137                                 if (pw == NULL)
00138                                 {
00139                                         fprintf (stderr, "Can't find user %s\n", optarg);
00140                                         return (1);
00141                                 }
00142                                 uid = pw->pw_uid;
00143                         }
00144                         break;
00145 
00146                 case 'g':
00147                         if (*optarg == '#')
00148                         {
00149                                 gid = (gid_t)strtol (optarg + 1, &term, 0);
00150                                 if (term == optarg + 1)
00151                                 {
00152                                         fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse numeric gid %s\n", optarg);
00153                                         return (1);
00154                                 }
00155                         } else {
00156                                 struct group *gr = getgrnam (optarg);
00157 
00158                                 if (gr == NULL)
00159                                 {
00160                                         fprintf (stderr, "Can't find group %s\n", optarg);
00161                                         return (1);
00162                                 }
00163                                 uid = gr->gr_gid;
00164                         }
00165                         break;
00166 
00167                 case 't':
00168                         type = optarg;
00169                         break;
00170 
00171                 case 'a':
00172                         absent = 1;
00173                         break;
00174 
00175                 case 'v':
00176                         verbose++;
00177                         break;
00178 
00179                 case 'f':
00180                         follow++;
00181                         break;
00182 
00183                 case 'h':
00184                         usage (argv[0], 1);
00185                         return (0);
00186 
00187                 default:
00188                         usage (argv[0], 0);
00189                 }
00190 
00191         if (optind == argc)
00192                 usage (argv[0], 0);
00193 
00194         do
00195         {
00196                 char *fname = argv[optind];
00197                 int rc = follow ? stat64 (fname, &buf) : lstat64 (fname, &buf);
00198 
00199                 if (rc != 0)
00200                 {
00201                         if (!(absent && errno == ENOENT))
00202                         {
00203                                 if (verbose)
00204                                         printf ("Can't %sstat %s: %s\n",
00205                                                 follow ? "" : "l",
00206                                                 fname, strerror (errno));
00207                                 return (1);
00208                         }
00209 
00210                         if (verbose)
00211                                 printf ("%s: absent OK\n", fname);
00212                         continue;
00213                 }
00214 
00215                 if (absent)
00216                 {
00217                         if (verbose)
00218                                 printf ("%s exists\n", fname);
00219                         return (1);
00220                 }
00221 
00222                 if (type != NULL)
00223                 {
00224                         if (!strcmp (type, "d") ||
00225                             !strcmp (type, "dir"))
00226                         {
00227                                 if (!S_ISDIR (buf.st_mode))
00228                                 {
00229                                         if (verbose)
00230                                                 printf ("%s is not a directory\n",
00231                                                          fname);
00232                                         return (1);
00233                                 }
00234                         }
00235                         else if (!strcmp (type, "f") ||
00236                                  !strcmp (type, "file"))
00237                         {
00238                                 if (!S_ISREG (buf.st_mode))
00239                                 {
00240                                         if (verbose)
00241                                                 printf ("%s is not a regular file\n",
00242                                                         fname);
00243                                         return (1);
00244                                 }
00245                         }
00246                         else if (!strcmp (type, "l") ||
00247                                  !strcmp (type, "link"))
00248                         {
00249                                 if (!S_ISLNK (buf.st_mode))
00250                                 {
00251                                         if (verbose)
00252                                                 printf ("%s is not a link\n",
00253                                                         fname);
00254                                         return (1);
00255                                 }
00256                         }
00257                         else
00258                         {
00259                                 fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse file type %s\n",
00260                                          type);
00261                                 return (1);
00262                         }
00263 
00264                         if (verbose)
00265                                 printf ("%s has type %s OK\n", fname, type);
00266                 }
00267 
00268                 if (perms != -1)
00269                 {
00270                         if ((buf.st_mode & ~S_IFMT) != perms)
00271                         {
00272                                 if (verbose)
00273                                         printf ("%s has perms 0%o, not 0%o\n",
00274                                                 fname, (buf.st_mode & ~S_IFMT),
00275                                                 perms);
00276                                 return (1);
00277                         }
00278 
00279                         if (verbose)
00280                                 printf ("%s has perms 0%o OK\n",
00281                                         fname, perms);
00282                 }
00283 
00284                 if (size != -1) {
00285                         if (buf.st_size != size) {
00286                                 if (verbose)
00287                                         printf("%s has size %lld, not %lld\n",
00288                                                fname, (long long)buf.st_size,
00289                                                size);
00290                                 return 1;
00291                         }
00292 
00293                         if (verbose)
00294                                 printf("%s has size %lld OK\n", fname, size);
00295                 }
00296 
00297                 if (checklink != NULL)
00298                 {
00299                         static char lname[4<<10];
00300 
00301                         rc = readlink (fname, lname, sizeof (lname) - 1);
00302 
00303                         if (rc < 0)
00304                         {
00305                                 if (verbose)
00306                                         printf ("%s: can't read link: %s\n",
00307                                                 fname, strerror (errno));
00308                                 return (1);
00309                         }
00310 
00311                         lname[rc] = 0;
00312                         if (strcmp (checklink, lname))
00313                         {
00314                                 if (verbose)
00315                                         printf ("%s is a link to %s and not %s\n",
00316                                                 fname, lname, checklink);
00317                                 return (1);
00318                         }
00319 
00320                         if (verbose)
00321                                 printf ("%s links to %s OK\n", fname, checklink);
00322                 }
00323 
00324                 if (uid != (uid_t)-1)
00325                 {
00326                         if (buf.st_uid != uid)
00327                         {
00328                                 if (verbose)
00329                                         printf ("%s is owned by user #%ld and not #%ld\n",
00330                                                 fname, (long)buf.st_uid, (long)uid);
00331                                 return (1);
00332                         }
00333 
00334                         if (verbose)
00335                                 printf ("%s is owned by user #%ld OK\n",
00336                                         fname, (long)uid);
00337                 }
00338 
00339                 if (gid != (gid_t)-1)
00340                 {
00341                         if (buf.st_gid != gid)
00342                         {
00343                                 if (verbose)
00344                                         printf ("%s is owned by group #%ld and not #%ld\n",
00345                                                 fname, (long)buf.st_gid, (long)gid);
00346                                 return (1);
00347                         }
00348 
00349                         if (verbose)
00350                                 printf ("%s is owned by group #%ld OK\n",
00351                                         fname, (long)gid);
00352                 }
00353         } while (++optind < argc);
00354 
00355         return (0);
00356 }
